intro: Chaenactis paleolifera, commonly known as the paleolithic raylessweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, commonly known as the sunflower family, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open habitats. It has small, often inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs. This species is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in disturbed or marginal areas.
